Eis que surpreendentemente um jogo da categoria F2P conseguiu colocar um sorriso no meu rosto. N√£o que os jogos F2P n√£o sejam bons, mas aqui vejo um produto com qualidade de um jogo pago. Gravitas funciona muito bem como uma homenagem a portal, mesmo acreditando que alguns aspectos sobretudo da f√≠sica poderiam ter recebido maior polimento, neste ponto senti que os cubos s√£o muito mais leves do que inicialmente aparentam e de forma geral se comparado a portal a f√≠sica aqui parece bem menos veross√≠mil e isso a meu ver atrapalhou um pouco a imers√£o.
Agora, se por um lado o jogo √© uma homenagem bastante competente, por outro eu n√£o vi nele nenhuma grande novidade. Todo o jogo parece ser uma grande homenagem ao que foi feito e n√£o senti nenhuma nova proposta, ele n√£o contribui com nada proprio. √â possivel sentir que tudo ali √© bastante parecido com portal, mas falta talvez adicionar algo que seja propriamente do gravitas. Tomando como exemplo o proprio Portal: no primeiro jogo temos o conceito de portais sendo aplicado em uma diversidade de situa√ß√µes e esse conceito √© explorado de formas diferentes e √∫nicas em cada n√≠vel, em Portal 2 voce tem as mesmas mecanicas do primeiro jogo, mas tambem as pontes de luz e as tintas que modificam o cen√°rio que adicionam novas possibilidades aos puzzles e melhoram aquilo que j√° existia. –ë–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π "Portal" –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª —á–∞—Å–∞. –ö—Ä–∞–π–Ω–µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤—Å–µ–º –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫.

2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
1
Recommand√©
1.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 septembre 2020
First and foremost, despite what some people claim, this is NOT a clone of Portal. There are exactly five ways in which this game and the Portal games are similar. 1) Both this and the Portal games are puzzle games. 2) Both this and the Portal games use first-person perspective. 3) Both this and the Portal games feature cubes. 4) Both this and Portal (or Portal 2) use gravity beams (in Portal, they are the blue and orange beams that pull you or push you along the path of the beam). 5) Both this and the Portal games have a humorous narrator/observer who is testing you. Can you guess what this game doesn't have? Yes, you guessed it -- portals! It's kind of hard to be a Portal clone when there are no portals of any kind. While I strongly suspect this game was inspired by Portal, it most definitely is not a clone of Portal.

Now, having dispelled that fallacy, I can say that Gravitas is a short (1 to 1.5 hours) puzzle games in which the base mechanic is using gravity beams to manipulate the placement of cubes and to get your character through the test chambers. All of the test chambers are logical and none are too difficult (though it did take me an embarrassingly-long 20 minutes to find the solution to one of them).

I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone who likes puzzle games. The only downside I can see is it's length -- it definitely left me wanting more -- but it's hard to complain about that considering the game is free. I'd happily pay for a longer game like this.
 
Mindcrime

I only got this game because it was free and I'd read that it had somewhat of a Portal feel to it, and after playing through it twice, I can only say that... I ABSOLUTELY LOVE GRAVITAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I fell in love with the game just by watching the trailer, and it only got better!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 aout 2019
A neat puzzle game. Very reminiscent of Portal 2, the helper man is VERY similar to Wheatley in his humour and tone but that isn't a bad thing. The puzzles are good, but the game would benefit with a couple of harder ones if the game was longer. However for the game length it was great. And it's free! SHI/The Curator are a good combo too and made the game lighthearted and fun.
 
DwindlingStorm
92 produits enregistr√©s
0
41 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
2.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 novembre 2019
This game is incredible. Personally, I'm a huge fan of Portal 2, I would say it's in my Top 5 favorite video games of all time. After completing Portal 2, there was a void in my heart, hoping I could have more... Gravitas fills this void.

Gravitas places the player into an "art" gallery. There they are given gloves that can generate gravitational fields on certain surfaces. The player must then pass through a few courses. Each of these courses was unique and challenging through a first play-through. The humor was funny, as well as the characters such as the Curator (reminiscent of Wheatly from Portal 2). The dialogue is well written as well as the responses to actions made by the player. On my second play-through I found myself looking for all the secrets to 100% the game. The game itself is very short. And can be completed in 30min - 1hr depending on how much detail you take in from the game.

The game is very short, but sweet. It's free. Most importantly, it's fun. If you ever find yourself looking for something short that'll keep you entertained. This is most certainly it.

I would love to see more of this. I really hope a full fledged game like this comes out.
 
phoenix0fEmbers

Recommand√©

√âvaluation publi√©e le 21 novembre 2020
Loved every second of it, from the start to the end!
As a big portal fan this was right up my alley
Actually quick PSA:
please, if you too loved the portal series, do yourself a favor and play this, will ya?

Premise aside, everything was perfectly tuned for a great, albeit short, game!
Music, mechanics, level design (player interaction, even!)...

The curator was the absolutely best part of it and it makes me WISH everything was longer & bound to a longer story.
Nevertheless, this was amazing and I can only hope for more content to come for the creators over at Galaxy Shark Studios

Thanks for reading and happy... Appreciating :3

Lord_Kristof
0
28 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 septembre 2022
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Gravitas is a comedic and narrative heavy 3D puzzle-platformer primarily about manipulating gravity. Entirely free to play, it is very short with about 30 to 60 minutes of story and levels.

After docking at an unusual space station you meet an excitable and eccentric robot that calls themself ‚ÄòCurator‚Äô who acts as your guide through ‚ÄòGORG‚Äô - the Gallery of Refined Gravity. Shortly after you meet him you are presented with a ‚Äògravity glove‚Äô which allows you to target designated spots on walls to create beams of light capable of slowly transporting yourself and objects across obstacles.

I found all the puzzles to be relatively easy and straightforward, I could usually see exactly what the game wanted me to do the moment I walked into the level but they are creative. The controls are pretty solid too, so even the platforming wasn‚Äôt a hindrance, the couple of times I did miss felt very much like my own fault. A chapter select is available in the main menu if you want to go back and pick up any missed achievements after completing the game.

There are obvious similarities to the Portal franchise; from the structure of the levels and puzzles, right down to Curator being remarkably like the whimsical Wheatley. Despite that, what it has achieved is polished and done extremely well. It is absolutely a fun and worthwhile experience, something I would love for it to receive an expanded sequel.
 
Ghostie

Gravitas ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –≤ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–µ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä-–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ —Å –≤–∏–¥–æ–º –æ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è —Å–º–∞—Ö–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ–º–∏ –Ω–∞–º–∏ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—É—é –∏–≥—Ä—É "Portal". –°–∞–º —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ—Å–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–∏, —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –≤ –ì–∞–ª–µ—Ä–µ–∏ –£—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ì—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –¢–∞–º –∂–µ –º—ã –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏–º "–°–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ" —Å –Ω–∞—à–∏–º –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –±—É–¥–µ—Ç, —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞ —ç–∫—Å–∫—É—Ä—Å–∏–∏. –í –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–æ–≤ –∫–∞–∫ –∏–∑–±—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π —É—á–µ–Ω–∏–∫, –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –¥–∞—ë—Ç –Ω–∞–º "–ì—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—É—é –ü–µ—Ä—á–∞—Ç–∫—É". –≠—Ç–∞ –≤–µ—â–∏—Ü–∞ –ø–æ —Ç–∏–ø—É –ø—É—à–∫–∏ –∏–∑ "Portal", –Ω–æ —Å –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏. –ò —Ç—É—Ç –º—ã –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ–º –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–æ–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–æ–µ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –ø–æ –æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω—ã–º –∏ –∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è–º. –ù–∞—Å –∂–¥—ë—Ç –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ 6 —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–π. –ò –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ-—Ç–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–æ–≤–∫–∞. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –º–Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ—Å—å —Ä–µ–ø–ª–∏–∫–∏ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –ø—Ä–∏ –∞–ª—å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è—Ö, –≤ –∏–≥—Ä–µ —Ä–∞–¥—É–µ—Ç –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –∫–∞–∫ –ø–æ –º–Ω–µ. –ò–≥—Ä–∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –∏ –∑–∞—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Ö–≤–∞–ª—ã —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º. –î–∞ –∏ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–∞—è, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∏ —Ä–∞–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å. –ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞ –ï—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ–º–∞–ª–æ –±–∞–≥–æ–≤, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –º–∏–Ω—É—Å —Å—ä–µ–¥–∞–µ—Ç –µ—ë —Ü–µ–Ω–∞(–∞ –æ–Ω–∞ –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–∞—è), —Ä–µ–ø–ª–∏–∫–∏. –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞. –ü—Ä–æ—à—ë–ª —è –µ—ë –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –≤–¥–æ—Ö–µ, –æ–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω–æ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é

Recommand√©
1.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 mai 2020
Overall Score: 7.5/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Visuals: 6/10
Audio: 9/10
Story: N/A

Price/Value: 10/10 (Free)

Pros:
Really enjoyable, easy-to-grasp gameplay, which is effectively just Portal's gravity bridge mechanic. Levels are pretty well thought out for the most part, and the visuals are pretty clean. The Curator is also really enjoyable to have around, he and SHI give the game a ton of character. Really similar humor to Portal or The Stanley Parable. A decent number of achievements and some easter eggs to go for as well, if that's your thing.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
Far too short, which is unfortunate considering how good the game is. I'd be willing to pay a few dollars if the game was at least 3 or 4 times as long, with the same level and writing quality. Graphics and certain puzzle physics could use polishing in some areas, but nothing major.

Conclusion & Thoughts:
A wonderful, free Portal clone, with lots of charm. After getting 100% completion, I still wanted more. Very few flaws, the most major one being how short it is, which should tell you something. If you're a fan of Portal or just puzzle games in general, definitely give it a shot.
 
Nyahr
1
22 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 octobre 2019
Gravitas is a very short, quirky puzzle game seemingly inspired by Portal.

The game is extremely short, which is a shame, because I can't get enough of the Curator and Shi. While Portal had funny and lovable characters, Gravitas takes it up a notch and was much funnier to me - The jokes are greatly amusing and the voice acting is absolutely spot on. The line about the one-way mirrors had me gasping for air, it was freaking hilarious.

I really, really would like a full-length game like this one, and hopefully this is only a taste of what's to come from Galaxy Shark Studios. I for one, will definitely be keeping an eye out for future projects by this developer.
 
jbondguy007

Produit re√ßu gratuitement

First off, this game is very short and shouldn't take more than an hour to beat. The game plays similar to the Portal series and some of the levels have multiple solutions, depending on how your brain works. Also, for any achievement hunters out there, this game is pretty easy to 100% and I would recommend going for it. And to top it all off? This game is free!

Recommand√©

√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 septembre 2019
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

A short but fun Portal-esque puzzle game which is easy to 100%.

While the game is very short, it's also a lot of fun. If you're familiar with the excursion funnels and cubes in Portal 2, this game is essentially using those mechanics as it's main selling point. I quite enjoyed the dialogue, it actually once again reminded me of Portal 2 in that the main antagonist is strikingly similar to Stephen Merchant's Wheatley.

Wheatley: Indie Edition 
Une capture d'√©cran de Gravitas
Par : Lord Bork


Again, this is all subjective to the player but I got strong vibes of Portal with this little gem of a game.

Gravitas 
Une capture d'√©cran de Gravitas
Par : Lord Bork


I do have 1 small complaint though: Being unable to set custom keybinds. I see this all too frequently these days with new games and it really isn't something that should be an issue in 2019. Please fix.

TL;DR: Similar to Portal 2 in some ways and it's free so you've got no reason to not give it a shot. Highly recommended.

Pros y contras
Aspectos positivos:
‚Ä¢ Puzles ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• una dificultad justa, que aprovechan de formas originales su mec√°nica principal que es el uso de la gravedad (siempre me gusta que los juegos aprovechen de formas distintas una mec√°nica que presentan, da la sensaci√≥n de que la saben explotar y de un buen dise√±o de nivel).
‚Ä¢ Sus personajes, que son divertidos y carism√°ticos. Es muy f√°cil encari√±arse ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ellos.

Aspectos negativos:
‚Ä¢ Peque√±os detalles como pueden ser di√°logos que tendr√≠an mucho m√°s sentido que se activasen √∫nicamente en el caso de que realicemos una acci√≥n concreta, o la interfaz, que no est√° traducida y puede llegar a generar un poco de confusi√≥n.

Desarrollo
‚ÄîBienvenido, lector, a mi m√°s grande y ambiciosa rese√±a, un proyecto en el que trabaj√© durante A√ëOS para tu deleite (y por supuesto, experimentaci√≥n. La empresa GORG ni yo nos hacemos responsables por el posible traumatismo craneoencef√°lico, estr√©s postraum√°tico, lesiones en las pompis o cualquier otro tipo de afecci√≥n negativa directa o indirecta hacia su persona, causada por las faltas ortogr√°ficas o los sin sentidos escritos por el autor). Mi nombre es... emm... ¬øJoe?... EL CONSERVADOR ¬´S√≠, suena bien¬ª, y estoy aqu√≠ para guiarte en...
‚ÄîA GORG Reminder: Joe es el nombre del alumno N¬∫ 759 que muri√≥ en la c√°mara 4 hace 2 meses a ra√≠z de un l√°ser que le perfor√≥ el...
‚Äî¬°¬°SHI, NO ASUSTES A MI ALUMNO!!, digo, ejem, ¬°¬°LECTOR!!, no sabes lo que me cuesta conseguir uno.
Me encanta ver como ciertos t√≠tulos de puzles en primera persona, se inspiran en Portal (uno de mis juegos favoritos desde siempre), pero formando su propia identidad y un mundo completamente distinto. Esto es Gravitas, un videojuego de puzles en primera persona que, como podr√°s deducir por su nombre, su principal mec√°nica distintiva es el control limitado de la gravedad.
Esto lo conseguiremos gracias al uso de un guante especial, que se nos conceder√° al comienzo de la aventura. Tendremos que hacer uso de la gravedad de distintas formas, para poder superar las c√°maras u obras de la galer√≠a espacial de El conservador. Algunas de esas formas pueden ser, usarla para poder ascender a lugares altos, desplazar cajas gigantes para formar puentes, destruir cristales o incluso obstruir l√°seres y as√≠ evitar la muerte.

Gravitas 
Une capture d'√©cran de Gravitas
Par : 1caruxx

Esta es una experiencia muy corta, que puede rondar alrededor de una o dos horas dependiendo de como se juegue, que pienso que sirve a modo de demostraci√≥n de este concepto o f√≥rmula.
El juego posee algunos elementos que me gustaron bastante y que quisiera remarcar. El primero de ellos, sus personajes. Desde ya que su plantel no es demasiado grande, y no lo necesita. Agradezco que el juego tenga solo dos personajes y tan bien trabajados. El conservador es un peque√±o robot que nos va a guiar durante nuestro viaje por su galer√≠a y SHI es una inteligencia artificial que lo molesta. Ambos personajes brillan no solo por su personalidad, vista a trav√©s de sus frases y la forma en que interact√∫an entre ellos y ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• vos, que resultan divertidas de ver y escuchar, sino tambi√©n por el doblaje que les da vida. Se nota que los talentosos actores de voz se esforzaron para llevarlos a cabo, siendo la voz de El conservador muy graciosa y la de SHI hasta tierna.
‚ÄîActivando protocolo de sonrojamiento.
SHI se sonroja.
Lo √∫nico negativo a resaltar de este apartado, es que algunos di√°logos que tendr√≠a sentido que se activasen al hacer algo en particular, saltan sin la necesidad de que nosotros lo hagamos. Por ejemplo, SHI, en la primera sala, menciona algo referente a un alto nivel de vandalismo en el sal√≥n principal (que es donde estamos), pero puede que ni te hayas movido y ese di√°logo se activase. Ser√≠a genial que lo dijese si, por ejemplo, tir√°semos los cestos de basura.

Gravitas 
Une capture d'√©cran de Gravitas
Par : 1caruxx

El otro aspecto que me gust√≥ bastante de este juego fueron sus puzles. Como bien dije antes, a pesar de ser un juego cortito, aprovecha de distintas formas la gravedad para mostrar este concepto. Me parecen puzles originales ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• una dificultad justa, que no son muy complicados, pero entender lo pr√≥ximo que se deba hacer te puede llevar un rato no muy extenso, haci√©ndolos bastante fluidos e interesantes. En mi caso, esta es la tercera vez que lo juego (habiendo dejado un buen tiempo de por medio para tener la experiencia fresca) y entendiendo el concepto de antemano, me pas√© el juego ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• bastante facilidad. Esto se traduce en que lo m√°s complicado, puede llegar a ser el saber las distintas formas en que se puedan usar los elementos que tenemos a nuestra disposici√≥n, las cajas, la gravedad, etc√©tera. Un peque√±o detalle algo negativo quiz√°s (pero para nada preocupante), es que me hubiese gustado que el guante que usamos para controlar la gravedad, se muestre en pantalla en todo momento, como en la mayor√≠a de juegos en primera persona, que muestran la herramienta que tengamos en mano actualmente. Gravitas 
Une capture d'√©cran de Gravitas
Par : 1caruxx

La banda sonora del juego es muy relajada, aunque un tanto gen√©rica. As√≠ que pienso que la m√∫sica usada en este juego, es una lista de canciones previamente seleccionadas (que no tiene por que estar mal, solamente quer√≠a aclarar que esa fue la sensaci√≥n que me dio).
Finalmente, un √∫ltimo detalle m√≠nimo pero negativo que quiero incluir en esta rese√±a, es que a la hora de seleccionar un idioma desde el men√∫ principal, no not√© ning√∫n cambio en el momento. Me llam√≥ bastante la atenci√≥n esto, ya que mirando un video, un jugador de una versi√≥n m√°s antigua del juego, no ten√≠a este problema. Recommand√©
3.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 juillet 2020
This is that kind of game that i want to just never end.
This game was extremely fun even if it only lasted me half an hour on first run.
But I imagine i will be coming back to play this more and more.
I feel like this is the kind of game that would be popular with speedrunners.

If Galaxy Shark studios want to make a full game I have some recommendations:
-Make the story a bit longer, maybe 3-5 hours
-Workshop maps which can add infinite playtime, they did the same with portal 2
-I need to hear more of the curator, i just love his character and reactions when you speedrun a level

10/10 take my money when the full release
 
/shrug

Recommand√©
2.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 avril 2023
A GORG Reminder: This game is cool.

Honestly, how many puzzle games try to do the funny robot narrator and just copy GLaDOS in the worst way possible? None of that here. The puzzles are intuitive, the achievements for solving them differently are a nice addition, the game is short, but oh boy how the dialogue of The Curator and SHI carries this experience. Great performances and writing, funny and cute in just the right measure. Worth anyone's time!
 
Bunny

√âvaluation publi√©e le 21 janvier 2022
If you like Portal you will like it, its clearly inspired by it. But you use gravity instead of portals.
Also the story, the characters and dialogues are cute.
The puzzles gradually get harder but nothing crazy, easy and enjoyable.
Finding all achievements requires some patience and exploration.
Very cute, I recomend it.

Recommand√©
3.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 mars 2020
A short enjoyable puzzle game where you are a 'pupil' visiting the Gallery of Refined Gravity. All is not what it seems.
You have to move cubes via a gravity force and there are lasers in the later levels. You have a chatty curator who is either very funny or a pain in the butt. His sidekick is slightly dense.
There are shark collectables on every level. This game has achievements.
Amusing and fairly easy. Hey...it's free, so what are you waiting for?!
 
Hairy Mary
1,193 produits enregistr√©s
0
17 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 mars 2022
Gravitas is a short puzzle game that reminds a lot of the other game called "Portal".
You play a pupil whos spaceship docked to a so called "art gallery" and you have to pass all the different puzzles to "understand a lesson". While you are progressing, a robotic voice is going to comment on you. The voice acting was done really well and the sounds were realistically.
By equipping a special glove, you are now able to control gravity to solve the puzzles. The puzzles are quite interesting to solve and get more difficult over time. The humor is on point and I had a good laugh. The graphics look fine and the controls are quite smooth.
Overall it's a great and short game, but since it's free, give it a try if you enjoy puzzle games and you enjoyed playing "Portal".
 
Wolfgang Versace Mozart

Recommand√©
2.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 11 janvier 2021
God I miss Portal.

It's like a Kirkland version of Portal. There's good humor and a few really good jokes, but it's generally pretty safe and I somehow managed to beat it without googling answers constantly. Achievements are a nice challenge, though. Developer is really nice though, hope to see more from them in the future. Honestly I think they are REALLY close to finding the secret sauce, might just need a few more VAs or a cleaner mic. Gameplay is solid, no bugs, art style is clean and perfect. Want to see more from this dev.
 
Slinky

22 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
3 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
2.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 aout 2019
Probably one of my favorite bootlegs of Portal 2!

Yes, I say this game is a bootleg, but it does aim to be original in some areas. Gravitas borrows narrative elements from its source material and makes one of the mechanics of Portal 2 a key feature...and no...it's not the portal mechanic...it's the tractor beams along with the ability to move them around (like...imagine using a portal gun with only one portal setting instead of two). Yes, that does sound bad, but it actually works well...especially since you're getting this game for free. If anything, this game would make for a great demo to Portal 2 or even a spinoff.

Gravitas gives you AI companions like The Curator (the Wheatley of this game) and S.H.I. (for the generic announcer) who bicker back and forth...one with more unique dialog than the other...while the other one is static, but makes the role her own in a quasi-sarcastic manner. The plot is as you'd expect if you've played a Portal game before, but without the murderous AI hellbent on your destruction...now instead wanting your appreciation of their art gallery (or rather The Curator's gallery).

The humor in this 1-2 hour game is rich and builds off of what you would come to expect from Portal 2 and the graphics are well done. This is a student project from SMU Guildhall (the same institution that gave us Dawn) in which the team has done an outstanding job in creating a mini-Portal game for free. In fact, I loved this game so much that I wish that there was more to it. DLC, a sequel, comic spinoff, SFM videos, collab between The Curator and Wheatley, anything!!! Gravitas may be a watered down Portal 2 bootleg but it's a d*mn good bootleg that I would love to see more of.

Phew....my word....this title has made me so invigorated! I'm only saddened by the length of this project and am hoping there's more to it, especially since the greenlight video made me laugh hard. I hope this team treats this project as a demo for larger things to come. This game (again) can be completed in 1-2 hours and achievements are fairly easy to get. If you're looking for a good short game and miss the days of Portal then look no further. Gravitas is here to whet your appetite!

10/10 Gravitas may be half a Portal, but hot d*mn was it a fun ride!!!
 
Shrodu

No es un juego muy largo, son como 5 pantallas o puzzles, pero si no miras la soluci√≥n en internet y se te tiene que ocurrir a ti, pues no se hace en media hora.

Los controles se sienten bien y el juego tiene unos gr√°ficos normalitos, suficientes, para mi lo mejor del juego es tu anfitri√≥n o maestro que te va presentando los puzzles, un robot psic√≥pata muy gracioso. Las lineas est√°n escogidas ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• humor e inteligencia y el actor de voz lo hace genial.

Como un divertimento para jugar a ratitos, o entre otros juegos o si te van los puzzles para acabar en una tarde es muy aconsejable. Muy divertido.

Heredero directo de portal, pero original

11 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
4.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 juillet 2020
Gravitas is outstanding, and I have replayed it repeatedly even after gaining all the achievements, and here is why:

1) Its simply a great game, and I cant believe that such a great game would ever be released 100% for free

2) The NPCs will react to how you do things, like they get irritated if you ignore them and do nothing, or if you do something stupid like jumping into the pit, or get to the end of the tutorial without the gravity glove, and finding them all is just so hilarious

3) The game is so cleverly designed, and some of the levels even have multiple solutions, even going so far as one level having an achievement for doing it both the right way and the wrong way each respectively

4) The graphics and Audio are surprisingly good for an indie game, especially a free one.

5) The Developer is actively patching the games bugs even though they get no profit from this and that is more than worth respecting, and if I could find a way to support them I definitely would.

6) Its the perfect little short gem of a game to pass the time for around 15-45 minutes depending on how you play

In short, if any of these things are traits you want in a game, then this is definitely worth trying, and since it's free, it won't hurt you if you turn out not to like it anyway, although personally I hope you enjoy it since it is a great game and I think the developer needs to be more widely known given the quality of this game.
 
Phantomcreator42

–ö–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∞—è (–Ω—É –∞ —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä—ã!?), –Ω–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∫—Ä—É—Ç–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞!

‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†â‚†õ‚†ª‚†ø‚†ø‚†ø‚†ø‚†õ‚†â jugalo puto
 
Byte

10 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 novembre 2019
Gravity Manipulation!
Gravitas was a pleasant surprise. Nice visuals and sound, funny writing, interesting gameplay and puzzles and an idea and overall style reminiscent of Portal. Unfortunately, at least for me, the gravity glove was not as interesting a tool as the portal gun was. The gravity mechanic felt like it was getting old fast across the different rooms, but that might also have to do with the puzzles themselves. But, just when I was thinking that, the game reached its end with some very enjoyable last moments. Considering this is also a free game, made by a small team, I think congratulations are in order.
Highly recommend it, especially if you are a portal fan.
 
CosmosQuasar

Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Em geral √© um jogo que gira em torno de "Puzzle", muito similar a Portal mais n√£o tem rela√ß√£o com portais e sim a gravidade.. 9 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 aout 2019
Follow "First Person Exploration and Puzzle Games" for more games like this!
This is one of my highest rated first-person puzzlers, of literally hundreds. It's the first indie game I've played that successfully replicates the quirky humorous narration and atmosphere of Portal 1/2.

The only reason I rated it "4/5 Recommended" rather than "5/5 Must Play" is that it's very short (~40 mins) and the puzzles are not terribly challenging. However if that doesn't turn you off, I highly recommend it. If the developers ever turn this into a full-length game, it would be an instant recommendation.
 
BlueRaja

once when i was very young i ran out of pokemon to watch and began watching some weird show i don't remember the name of that was way shorter and clearly inspired by pokemon but was fun regardless because it wore its influence on its sleeve without being a complete ripoff

replace pokemon with portal and that's Gravitas

48 produits enregistr√©s
0
12 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 aout 2019
Vid√©o YouTube‚Ñ¢:  
Vues : 0


This will be compared to Portal, but it stands on it's own two feet. Yes, it has a few similarities (a robot and AI offering narration, puzzle solving through escape rooms, etc.) but I loved every second of this ~45 experience. Galaxy Shark Studios you should be very proud.

I want to see the gravitational pull mechanics expanded upon into a longer experience. Puzzles felt challenging without being overly complicated. Ugh, I love this game so much!
 
Tobacco

Gravitas ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –≤ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–µ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä-–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ —Å –≤–∏–¥–æ–º –æ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç –≤–∞—Å –≤ –ì–∞–ª–µ—Ä–µ—é –£—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ì—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ (—Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—É—é –∫–∞–∫ –ì–£–ì).

Recommand√©

√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 aout 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Gravitas is a really neat puzzle game. It can be completed in about an hour, and the puzzles aren't too difficult. If you like the Portal games, it has a similar feel to those games. I definitely recommend this if you're looking for a free game to kill an hour of your time.
 
JashtheShoe
109 produits enregistr√©s
0
7 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
5.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 avril 2020
Follow our Curator Group for more reviews
Gravitas is a short and sweet puzzle game that is clearly inspired by Portal, but doesn‚Äôt feel derivative. Some of the humor is lackluster compared to Portal, but this is also a low budget indie title, not a AAA studio release. Graphically, the game looks good for a puzzle game. There aren‚Äôt many puzzles, but most of them offer a decent amount of challenge, while still explaining new mechanics well. It took me about 45 minutes to beat, my game time is wrong because I left it open while away. Given that it‚Äôs free, an hour of playtime is about right. Gravitas seems more like a large demo than a full game, but it does a good job showing off the types of puzzles they can come up with. Overall, a solid free puzzle game that would work well as a paid game if they made more levels.

7/10
Visit our website[www.mmmreviews.com] for more in-depth reviews and recommendations
 
ManlyMeatMan

√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 septembre 2019
When you think of puzzle platformer you think of portal or talos principal.

Well gravitas is by far the best puzzle platformer i have ever played. Pick up you grave glove and use gravity plaques on walls ceilings to move yourself and boxes around. All i can say i enjoyed the game more than portal and talos principals.

10/10

Vid√©o YouTube‚Ñ¢:  
Vues : 0
 
Silver_SIr
3,107 produits enregistr√©s
0
9 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 avril 2022
A small free game based on gravity. There are five levels in total and it goes pretty fast. You spend more time on knocking out all the achievements.
The plot is in the style of "portal", where the computer creates a test for a person.
We are waiting for a bit of humor, a lot of lasers and fragments of broken glass, and a lot of dead penguins (which I feel sorry for the most).
The game is free, has a number of achievements for those who like to decorate their Steam profile. Achievements are quite simple (except for level 4, where I spent quite a lot of time), so the game can be safely attributed +1 to the perfect games in the perfectionist's showcase.
I recommend to get acquainted with this project to all lovers of puzzles.
 
Astaritus

Recommand√©
0.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 mars 2020
A really great puzzle game. I would definitely recommend if you enjoy short (~35 mins) games. the mechanics are pretty cool, it features a gravity beam, which you can use to pull objects and yourself across the room. The Curator has a great personality, he's like Wheatley, but smart. The only fault of this game is sometimes the collisions are a bit weird, especially in the giant garden room. And in offline mode, it doesn't count playtime / achievements. But overall it's a great game!
 
Dark Rozen

Good puzzle game like Portal, short but very enjoyable. Puzzles are easy to medium difficulty if you're used to the genre, only a couple of achievements are tough. Finally, free is unbeatable :p

Don't miss it! [9/10]

7 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 f√©vrier 2021
Main points:
- Delightfully charming humor
- Interesting and engaging puzzles
- Fun and unique mechanics
- Wonderful design even on lowest settings
- Doesn't require a beefy computer
- Shouldn't take too long to complete
- 20 Achievements from story / easter eggs
- Barely any bugs and none impact game-play
- FREE

Other comments:
- Similar environment to Portal 1/2 by Valve
- The best level for the "Recycling" achievement is the last one ;)
- Even if you don't like puzzles give it a shot; it's free and very well made

The graphics look pleasing and the voice acting is hilarious. The writing is witty and funny, the way the characters interact is hilarious and the puzzle design feels like a true loving homage to portal. Though it is short, very short, awesome to kill time but i wish there was more content, i can't complain though, the game is free and that's a damn good price.

Overall i would 100% recommend it to anyone who likes puzzlers and dark comedy.

Es un juego corto, pero disfrutable, la verdad no he jugado portal pero he escuchado que este juego es un digno sucesor. Puede que portal sea muy bueno, no lo se. Pero eso no cambia el hecho de que este juego entretenga mucho el tiempo que dura (en mi caso que perdi tiempo observando el escenario etc 2 horas). Al ser un juego gratis tampoco tengo quejas ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• que dure poco, aunque es verdad que una segunda parte o una continuaci√≥n me agradaria siempre y cuando no baje el nivel.

En resumen, para jugar un rato, si quieres introducirte en juegos de puzzles o probar algo distinto a los tipicos juegos donde siempre se dispara es una buena opci√≥n.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 juillet 2021
–ú–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∞—è, –Ω–µ—Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–∞—è, –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ –≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ –ü–æ—Ä—Ç–∞–ª.
 
h 4 z e
920 produits enregistr√©s
0
6 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
1.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 aout 2022
Please enjoy your visit to the GORG!
Taking clear and obvious inspiration from Portal (hardly a bad example to follow), Gravitas is a game all about "experiencing art" - under the pretence of puzzle solving.

While the physics can be a little odd at times and the movement can also be slightly weird, Gravitas does an excellent job at keeping you entertained through its witty writing, and particularly the ever-present companions. SHI in particular is brilliant: somehow they have managed to make a character who sounds almost sickly sweet and a little dense seem absolutely adorable.

If you enjoyed Portal and/or similar style games, Gravitas should be a treat. Charming, sweet and without any microtransactions or ulterior motives for profit, Gravitas is worth the time investment. The cliffhanger ending will hopefully lead to a sequel and slightly longer title - but for now, this is what we have, and it is enough to whet the appetite.

Best part? It's free.

Played on Windows 11 Pro x64 with one crash.
 
Captain Titus
0
4 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 mai 2020
This game is a gravity Portal 2. And yknow what? That's a GOOD thing. Valve hasn't done- no, NOBODY is doing this type of game right now. While still very derivative, and short on playtime, for the price of free, the classic style easter eggs in the, simple but leisurely level design, THIS GAME IS INCREDIBLE. I really hope the developer see's this game more as a demo, and puts more time and content into the game.

Unreal engine is Unreal.

VA is great.

8/8

√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 septembre 2020
Gravitas ist ein nur rund einst√ºndiges, kostenloses Puzzlespiel im Stile von Portal und Co. Die grundlegende Spielmechanik ist dabei sehr √§hnlich zu Portal: Mit einem Handschuh kreiert man Gravitationsportale durch die man selber oder W√ºrfel angezogen werden und versucht so durch einen Raum zum Ausgang zu kommen.

Diese R√§tselmechanik funktioniert sehr gut und macht auch durchaus Spass. Die R√§tsel sind alle gut gemacht und ben√∂tigen z.T. tats√§chlich etwas nachdenken. Letztlich sind alle jedoch gut machbar und wirklich schwere R√§tselbrocken gibt es hier nicht. Und die R√§tsel alleine k√∂nnten durchaus schon ein gef√§lliger Grund sein, um dem Spiel vielleicht eine Chance zu geben.

Was jedoch das Spiel fast schon zu einem "muss" f√ºr Portal-Fans macht ist die zweite grosse Parallele. Wie die AI GlaDoS in Portal gibt es auch hier in Form des Kurators eine k√ºnstliche Intelligenz, die einen durch das Spiel f√ºhrt. Und wie beim grossen Vorbild, hat auch dieser seine gewissen Allmachtsfantasien und ist der eigentliche Star des Spiels. So sind auch hier die - toll auf Englisch vertonten - Monolge des Kurators (man selber bleibt stumm) resp. seine Dialoge mit dem Stationscomputer sehr witzig und kreativ gestaltet.

Fazit: Gravitas macht keinen Hehl aus seinem Vorbild und kopiert vieles sehr gef√§llig von Portal inkl. dem Humor. Klar kommt es nicht an die Qualit√§t des Originals heran, trotzdem bietet es rund 1 Stunde lang tolle Unterhaltung und das erst noch kostenlos. F√ºr Fans von Portal und Co ist das deshalb ein absolutes Pflichtspiel.

A short but great fun puzzle game to scratch the 3d puzzle/platform itch that you didn't realize you had until you start going through the rooms, which paired with some witty humor will have you enjoy the 45-ish minutes you need to complete it (and whatever time you need to get the achievements for that 100% completion).

Hopeful for a full, paid game built around this prototype in the future!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 avril 2020
Petit jeu de r√©flexion, qui rappelle immanquablement Portal sur bien des points, dans lequel il faut traverser plusieurs salles successives en r√©solvant des puzzles √† base de gravit√©.

C'est sympa et gratuit mais c'est tr√®s facile et tr√®s court.

 
karakatapakatapa
3,935 produits enregistr√©s
0
6 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 f√©vrier 2020
When I download Gravitas I didn't expect much of it but a fun looking free to play puzzle game, But this short Game has a charm which held me in to the 'story' and characters I didn't expect. I could find myself smiling and feeling a bit bad for the Curator.

The Puzzles are interesting, but easy most times. For as long as your with the Curator, the puzzles seem to flow smoothly only really picking up in difficulty when you leave the Curator to take your own way. There's nothing wrong with puzzles being easy but when it's coming from a puzzle game, I expected a little bit more Challenge ( When you leave the Curator on your path, The difficulty for rooms slightly Spikes. Which if you push aside the difficulty, some of the puzzles made you think at the back of my head ' I'm not doing this right' as I completed some levels, which I don't know if they we're trying to get that feeling but it made me feel Guilty for not completing it the way the coders and programmers intended).

I loved the Curators personality, which I will try to avoid here for those who want a spoiler free, but for those who don't want spoiler free: The Curator in the game seemed to indicate how the multiplitude of Puplies he had, always ended up dying to his hand or the inventions. He seemed to always feel horrible with himself when this happens, as you can tell when you 'lurk' on him before a puzzle. In order to increase his mood he has taken apon him the caring of Penguins . The computer and The Curator feel very well together, and their ( at least the Curators) personality always remains as they would, and not change to something different as to progress the Story. The mood for the curator, as well as the tone of his voice, is easily understandable with the variety of facial expressions his screen can do. I loved when you stayed in certain rooms for longer than he expected and he starts insulting you or trying to help you to get a move on, It makes him feel as he actually is watching and not just a static object to track your every move. I will say the Voices for the Computer and Curator is kinda confusing at first, ( well for me) I almost instantly pointed that they sounded like the same person with a different Filter, tone, or accent added onto them. But over time I did get used to this and thought of themselves as their own person.

The achievements were fun and challenging to get. I loved the solutions and how you would have to play through the game in order to understand how to get them when you restart. The only problems I had with them was that the descriptions on steam how to get them was not too clear, making me result to a achievement guide for the game. For example, When you have to complete level four without breaking the glass, I always thought it meant without swinging the 'wrecking ball' on the first glass and just collapsing the floor. It sounds stupid on an outside perspective cause you can't progress without breaking at least one, But the achievement photo and name made it seem like that was the way. The achievements are fun but I wish they were a teeny bit more clear how to get them on the description.

I enjoyed Gravitas more than I thought I would, and it was a shame how short it was compared to a lot other games. It was fun to figure out the personality of the Curator and his options to the things around him, and how he described the puzzle with little hints squeezed in between. Knowing this game is free is another plus ( But now i feel guilty cause this game feels like it should be, at minimum, a 5$ or higher), And i will be for sure recommending others with a love for Puzzles but relaxation this game. I will surely be coming back for more

My rating:
At minimum: 6/10
Highest: 8/10
 
DimIdiot

Gravitas to gra studia Galaxy Shark Studios z gatunku logicznych platform√≥wek. Trzeba w niej wiƒôc trochƒô pomy≈õleƒá, co mo≈ºe byƒá momentami nieco k≈Çopotliwe.


‚áù Grafika. Utrzymana w klimatach futurystycznych. Raczej minimalistyczna, posiadajƒÖca kilka bazowych kolor√≥w. Jest te≈º bardzo estetyczna i sp√≥jna, wiƒôc przypad≈Ça mi do gustu.

‚áù Audio. Czƒô≈õƒá muzyczna w niekt√≥rych momentach rozgrywki potrafi byƒá bardzo przyjemna "tranquil music". Lecz, gdy po raz 10 pr√≥bujemy przej≈õƒá dany etap, to najlepszƒÖ opcjƒÖ jest jej wyciszenie. Dialogi sƒÖ dobrze wykonane, momentami sƒÖ lekkie przestery (kiedy na nas krzyczƒÖ :c ), co by o nich jednak nie m√≥wiƒá starajƒÖ siƒô byƒá zabawne i trzeba im to oddaƒá.

‚áù Otoczenie. Zbudowane jest z pomieszcze≈Ñ oraz korytarzy dziƒôki, kt√≥rym przechodzimy do nastƒôpnego etapu, wed≈Çug mnie jest to ≈õwietnym rozwiƒÖzaniem, poniewa≈º gra stawia na realizm, a nie na wygodƒô. Mapki sk≈ÇadajƒÖ siƒô z element√≥w takich jak lasery, wiry grawitacyjne, pola grawitacji, szklane ≈õciany itd. Ka≈ºdy poziom jest zupe≈Çnie inny.

‚áù Fizyka. Idea ca≈Çej gry opiera siƒô na manipulowaniu grawitacjƒÖ. Wiƒôc fizyka odgrywa fundamentalnƒÖ rolƒô. Pokoje skonstruowane sƒÖ do≈õƒá logicznie i nie wystƒôpujƒÖ w nich ≈ºadne anomalie fizyczne bƒÖd≈∫ animacyjne ( chyba, ≈ºe co≈õ mnie ominƒô≈Ço :p ). Mo≈ºe nie wszystkie przedmioty (w poczekalniach) sƒÖ ruchome jednak≈ºe mo≈ºemy wywr√≥ciƒá, np kosz wysypujƒÖc przy okazji ≈õmieci. Tak≈ºe fizyka jest na plusik.

‚áù Interfejs. Przejrzysty i minimalistyczny. Niestety nie posiada zbyt wielu opcji. Czasem wystƒôpujƒÖ te≈º b≈Çƒôdy, gdy po ponownym wczytaniu gry opcje nie zostajƒÖ zapisane.

‚áù Fabu≈Ça. Rozpoczyna siƒô przyjemnƒÖ muzyczkƒÖ z windy. Znajdujemy siƒô w kosmosie, w wielkiej galerii sztuki nowoczesnej. Gdzie≈õ z chmur jaka≈õ pani m√≥wi nam co mamy robiƒá i otwiera nam drzwi do pomieszczenia, w kt√≥rym wita nas ma≈Çy uroczy latajƒÖcy robot takimi oto s≈Çowami : " you are so cute pupil". Dostajemy magicznƒÖ rƒôkawicƒô i uczy nas on jak jej u≈ºyƒá. Nasz mechaniczny przyjaciel towarzyszy nam podczas pokonywania kolejnych poziom√≥w. Jak siƒô okazujƒô to on jest tw√≥rcƒÖ tej galerii, a my jego kr√≥likiem do≈õwiadczalnym.Wiƒôkszo≈õƒá fabu≈Çy toczy siƒô wok√≥≈Ç dialog√≥w robota, kt√≥ry k≈Ç√≥ci siƒô z" lud≈∫mi w chmurach" lub daje nam jak≈ºe ≈õwietne rady. Przerywniki fabularne bywajƒÖ denerwujƒÖce, poniewa≈º wczytujƒÖc od nowa poziom zn√≥w musimy je oglƒÖdaƒá. Historia posiada jednak kilka zwrot√≥w akcji i potrafi zaskoczyƒá.

‚áù Rozgrywka. Polega na dostaniu siƒô do specjalnego punktu w danym pomieszczeniu. By to zrobiƒá musimy wykonywaƒá logiczne sekwencje z pomocƒÖ wielkich kostek oraz naszej magicznej rƒôkawicy tworzƒÖcej wir, kt√≥rym mo≈ºemy przenosiƒá obiekty lub w niego wskoczyƒá. Brzmi banalnie, jednak wcale nie jest, poniewa≈º wir kompatybilny jest tylko z ≈õcianami grawitacyjnymi, kt√≥re rozmieszczone sƒÖ w dziwaczny spos√≥b.

‚áù Cena. A w zasadzie jej brak jest du≈ºƒÖ zaletƒÖ tej produkcji.

PodsumowujƒÖc. Gravitas to ciekawa gra, w kt√≥rej mamy okazje wykazaƒá siƒô naszƒÖ inteligencjƒÖ i trochƒô pobudziƒá rozleniwiony umys≈Ç, (np: ca≈Çodniowym maratonem gier) do dzia≈Çania. Gra bywa bardzo upierdliwa, jednak pokonywanie kolejnych poziom√≥w daje sporƒÖ satysfakcjƒô. Przej≈õcie ca≈Çej gry zajƒô≈Ço mi oko≈Ço 6 godzin wiƒôc jest niestety dosyƒá kr√≥tka. Mimo wszystko polecam.

Um √≥timo jogo indie, se baseando em v√°rios aspectos com Portal, principalmente na tem√°tica de fic√ß√£o cient√≠fica. Dessa vez, ao inv√©s de controlar portais, o jogador pode manipular a gravidade. Divertido e gratuito, vale muito a pena jogar. IceCreamYouScream
0
4 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 f√©vrier 2021
30 minutes to beat. This is a puzzle game that requires you to utilize gravity beams to pull cubes and your character around a room in order to make a way for you to reach the exit. The game is just long enough to show you a variety of ways to solve gravity puzzles, then it ends. I enjoyed the puzzles and would enjoy playing a full length game with this mechanic.

The dialog is also superb, setting up an interesting love-hate relationship with The Curator who desperately wants someone to see his puzzles but is upset at how quickly you can solve them. He even makes some snide remarks if you run past him without listening to what he has to say. This was a nice touch.
 
wizcreations

‚òë Beginner
‚òë Casual Gamer
‚òë Normal Gamer
‚òê Expert

‚òê Bad
‚òê Alright
‚òë Good
‚òê Beautiful

‚òê Bad
‚òê Alright
‚òê Good
‚òê Beautiful
‚òë Fantastic

‚òë Average
‚òê Easy to learn / Hard to master
‚òê Hard
‚òê Unfair

‚òê Bugs destroy the game
‚òê Lots of bugs
‚òê Few Bugs
‚òê You can use them for speedrun
‚òë Minimal
‚òê Nothing encountered

‚òê There is none
‚òê Bad
‚òë Alright
‚òêGood

‚òë Really short (0 - 3 hours)
‚òê Short (4 - 8 hours)

‚òê Long (40-60 hours) [if you complete everything]
‚òê Very Long (61-100 hours)
‚òê Extremely Long (101+ hours)

‚òë Free
‚òê Full Price

Recommand√©
0.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 f√©vrier 2021
Gravitas is a puzzle game similar to Portal, experimenting with gravity in a test facility. It's a pretty short game (beatable in less than an hour), but for a free game it was a great experience. It's funny, and the puzzles are challenging but not too frustrating. If you like Portal, definitely try Gravitas because it's free and is very similar.

Recommand√©
1.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 octobre 2019
My best description of this game goes as follows; portal not by Valve. You could take that as a good thing or a bad thing. Do you want to play something new and creative? Well, don't look here. Are you looking for a solid game based on past successes? Then you discovered your next quick fix. Despite my subjective sub devil advocate critiquing, I do think this game is worth a play. Nothing brought me out of the experience. Writing is there to necessitate gameplay. Paired with quite a bit of funny moments, it continuously spews. Overall there isn't much I don't like about this game. I strongly suggest this game to people that are newer to computer gaming.

1
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
11.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 mars 2021
SINTESI DEL GAMEPLAY

Potrete collocare raggi traenti su apposite pareti o appositi cubi, raggi capaci di attrarre voi come i cubi appunto. Il gameplay FPP fonda tutto sulla risoluzione di puzzle, dove dovrete sfruttare a vostro vantaggio questa logica, cercando di raggiungere la porta di uscita, spesso evitando di rimanere inceneriti da laser posizionati come ostacoli (i cubi possono farvi da scudo e i raggi traenti da ponte per superarli).

ESTRO ARTISTICO

E' un figlio di Portal in tutto e per tutto (come anche il geniale Lightmatter che vi consiglio), nel senso che, come il capostipite del genere, il gioco ci immerge, in totale solitudine umana, dentro un ambiente "asettico" e labirintico, fatto di stanze, sale e corridoi, utili solo a definire puzzle concepiti da un comica A.I., che risulta grottesca quanto spietata.

PRO

E' scuola Portal da tutti i punti di vista! Il puzzle non sono troppo difficili ma comunque sempre ben congegnati.

CONTRO

Decisamente troppo corto, √® un po' uno spreco: l'impianto funziona molto bene, perch√© non sfruttarlo? Probabilmente gli sviluppatori non hanno creduto troppo nella loro opera.
 
Caligine

Ciubix8513
142 produits enregistr√©s
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 aout 2019
This is a cute game with clever dialogue, though the story is left largely to interpretation and it's very, very short. I completed the game in a little over an hour. I would recommend Gravitas if you're bored on a short trip and have access to your PC, because the dialogue is well-written and got quite a few chuckles out of me.

Pros:
-Fun gameplay reminiscent of Portal.
-Quick start, little to no tutorial slogging.
-Witty dialogue and amusing character dynamics between SHI and the Curator.
-Well-developed. I didn't run into a single bug or glitch during my play-through.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
-Very brief, can be completed in less than an hour if you hurry.
-Perhaps too easy for those looking for a puzzle game or who are used to Portal's challenges.
 
Noire

257 produits enregistr√©s

2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 aout 2023
A Weighty Puzzler that Lifts the Mind: Review of "Gravitas"

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ (4/5)

"Gravitas" invites players into a world of mind-bending physics puzzles, where the laws of gravity and creativity collide to create an engaging and thought-provoking gameplay experience. Developed by Studio Team-KwaKwa, this indie game showcases the potential of gravity-manipulating mechanics to challenge and entertain players in a visually charming universe.

The core gameplay of "Gravitas" revolves around manipulating the gravitational pull of objects to navigate puzzles and progress through levels. As a character named Sprocket, players use a special gravity-altering device to manipulate cubes and spheres, bending their paths and trajectories to solve increasingly complex puzzles.

The visual design of "Gravitas" is both whimsical and inviting. The game's colorful and playful aesthetic creates a delightful backdrop for the intricate puzzles, making the act of solving them feel like a satisfying journey through a unique universe. The visual cues and animations enhance the gameplay experience, helping players visualize the impact of their gravitational adjustments.

The puzzles themselves are the heart of "Gravitas." They start simple, teaching players the basics of gravitational manipulation, and gradually become more intricate and challenging. The game effectively introduces new mechanics and obstacles, preventing the puzzles from feeling repetitive and encouraging players to continually adapt their strategies.

The narrative is presented through humorous and lighthearted dialogue between Sprocket and the AI, voiced by Erik Braa. While not deeply profound, the dialogue adds personality and charm to the experience, creating a pleasant atmosphere that complements the puzzle-solving.

However, "Gravitas" might not appeal to players seeking a deep narrative or action-packed gameplay. The game's focus on puzzles means that players who prefer faster-paced experiences might find the gameplay slow at times.

In conclusion, "Gravitas" is a delightful puzzler that leverages gravity-based mechanics to create a captivating and engaging experience. Its charming visual design, clever puzzles, and approachable learning curve make it an ideal choice for players who enjoy exercising their logic and creativity. While it might not satisfy those looking for a narrative-driven adventure, "Gravitas" offers a refreshing and intellectually stimulating journey through a world where gravity is your plaything. If you're ready to put your problem-solving skills to the test in a whimsical universe, "Gravitas" is a worthy contender that's bound to provide a gravitatingly good time.
 
Dish

1. –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞. –ò –Ω–µ —Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø—å—é—Ç–µ—Ä–∞.

3. –í —à—É—Ç–∫—É –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –Ω–æ –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å —Å–º–µ—à–Ω–æ–π. –ê –µ—Å–ª–∏ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ, –≤ –Ω—ë–º –º–Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –∞–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞ –∏ —Å–º—ã—Å–ª —Å–ª–æ–≤. –ò —à—É—Ç–∫–∏ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç.
4. –ù–µ –º–æ–≥—É –Ω–µ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å—É–±—Ç–∏—Ç—Ä—ã. –ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∏ –±–µ–∑ –Ω–∏—Ö, –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π –Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω.
5. –ó–Ω–∞–µ—Ç–µ, —ç—Ç–æ —É–∂–µ –ª–∏—á–Ω–æ –æ—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—è –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞ —Å –∫–æ—Å–º–æ—Å–æ–º –∏ –æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–æ–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω—ã–µ –æ—â—É—â–µ–Ω–∏—è.
–°–ª–æ–≤–∞ –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è —Ç–æ–∂–µ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞—é—Ç.
6. –ê–∫—É–ª–∫–∏(:

–ú–∏–Ω—É—Å—ã:
–ö —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –Ω–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –º–∏–Ω—É—Å –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –æ–Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∞—è. –ë—É–∫–≤–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ª—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ —á–∞—Å–∞. –ü–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω—ã–π, –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –Ω–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ.


–°–º–µ–ª–æ –±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ, —É–≤–µ—Ä—è—é –≤–∞—Å, –≤–∞—à–∏ –æ–¥–∏–Ω-–¥–≤–∞ –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä–∞ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤–Ω–µ –∏–≥—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ä–∞—Å—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥—É—Ç –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ!!

Gravitas
–ì–æ–¥ —Ä–µ–ª–∏–∑–∞: 2019
–ñ–∞–Ω—Ä: –ì–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞
–û–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ: Gravitas ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –ø–ª–∞—Ç—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä-–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞ —Å –≤–∏–¥–æ–º –æ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç –≤–∞—Å –≤ –ì–∞–ª–µ—Ä–µ—é –£—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ì—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–π—Ç–µ –≥—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π –∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–π –≥–∞–ª–µ—Ä–µ–µ–π, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ –≤—ã —É—á–µ–Ω–∏–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–Ω —à–µ–¥–µ–≤—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è.

–ü–ª—é—Å—ã:
-–ê—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞. –í–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –∏–≥—Ä—ã –ø—Ä–æ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–Ω–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ, —á—Ç–æ –≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–º –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã. –ó–¥–µ—Å—å —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞, –∏ –µ—Å–ª–∏ —É –≤–∞—Å –≤–∏–¥–µ–æ–∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∞ –≤—Ä–µ–º—ë–Ω –ú–µ–∑–æ–∑–æ—è, –∫–∞–∫ —É –º–µ–Ω—è, –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ª—É—á—à–µ —Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å—Ä–∞–∑—É –Ω–∞ –Ω–∏–∑–∫–æ–µ. –•–æ—Ç—è, –æ–ø—è—Ç—å –∂–µ, –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–º –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–µ –≤—ã –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫—É –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –Ω–æ –∏ —Ç–æ, –Ω–∞—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –æ–Ω–∞ —É –≤–∞—Å –ª–∞–≥–∞–µ—Ç
-–û–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞. –í–æ—Ç —á—Ç–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —É–¥–∏–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç, —Ç–∞–∫ —ç—Ç–æ –æ–Ω–∞. –ù–µ–≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –¥–ª—è –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –≤–æ–∏—Å—Ç–∏–Ω—É

Great game, like portal as all the reviews are saying but I personally found this game quite a bit easier than both portal games. Expect it to take around 30-120mins. Both npcs in the game I found likable and enjoyed the voice acting for both.

Despite being a short game, this is one of the best games available for FREE. Really enjoyable puzzle game with gravity mechanics, and entertaining characters to follow you around. The only thing I felt annoyed with, is I really wanted to play more levels. Its THAT good of a game.

–Ø –±—ã –µ—â–µ —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª, –Ω–æ –º–Ω–µ –ª–µ–Ω—å ;)

0
Recommand√©
1.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 mai 2020
This is a cute game and funny puzzle game that's free. The puzzles are along the lines of something like Portal, Quantum Conundrum, etc., with a couple of quirky voices/characters who are a machines to keep you entertained along the way. It's quite short and satisfying enough for what it is. There isn't much to say without spoiling the game. Just give it a go. Worst case scenario, you don't enjoy it and can just uninstall without much time wasted.
 
Mr. Matt

√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 janvier 2020
A puzzle game that is the little brother to the Portal series, this is a great game to play, and I'm a little amazed that this isn't being sold in the store.

A little short (was able to get through the story in about an hour), but a very polished game, with great vocal work and a great script between the two NPCs.

Would recommend for all to play

mike24680
201 produits enregistr√©s
0
5 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 octobre 2020
It's not bad, but it is only around 45-60 minutes long with no real challenge, it does a good job of mimicking Portal aesthetics but has sadly none of the writing

There's no mistaking it wishes it was Portal, even the opening tutorial room looks like a very close copy of the one from the original Portal trailer! This isn't a crime by any means, it does some of the job very well, but it means the parts that miss the mark are all the more glaring.

The Curator is.. obnoxious. Games like this often force the player to listen to the monologues of "quirky" AI or scientist characters trying to set the scene but result in you standing in front of a locked door waiting play the game while they wrap up an unfunny joke that's gone on far, far too long. There were a few lines that made me smile in the middle but that's the most generous I can be.

Sadly there isn't a lot else to the game, though it feels pretty good!

Again, aesthetics (aside from the Curator himself) look wonderful, the mechanics and physics seem solid, the audio design is great, the visual feedback is well crafted.. but you only have a single ability, no alternate uses of it, and it only works on clearly marked surfaces. The only puzzle I was stuck on turned out to be that the gap that clearly looks too wide to jump across, actually is JUST possible to do so, and that really left a terrible taste in my mouth, just felt like awful design.

Cubes going through glass though is incredibly satisfying!

If you have 45 minutes, you could do far worse.
 
Nert

√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 juillet 2020
This game has a amazing blend of humor and solving puzzles. Some times the puzzles really get in your head and you have to think outside of the box, and when your about to give up you finally get it, or some character say something funny and gives you motivation to move on. This game has the same puzzle solving as portal 2, and the same hard driven humor as. There is no game.
So I highly recommend it.

This is good! You really need to work out some tricky moves to get through the levels. It's a shame it's so short. I presume that's to do with money, but I hope they get a deal to expand on it. The only down side for me is that sometimes there's too much talking going on while you wait to begin the level, but otherwise, well worth playing if you like problem solving games.

Recommand√©
1.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 aout 2019
A game with interesting mechanics and a simple but neat graphic.
Some puzzles have been difficult to solve, while most are intuitive.
I loved the characterization of the characters, especially "The Curator". His quarrels with the ship's artificial intelligence are great fun and help you relax.

I couldn't figure out how to get some achievements, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the unfortunately short but certainly enjoyable experience of the game.

If it had been more complex and longer I might have paid to play with it, but in its current state it was a good idea to distribute it for free.

Thanks for your attention and good game.
 
Vacui

√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 avril 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Meine Beurteilung zu Gravitas

Dieses Spiel hat echt sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht. Es ging zwar doch ganz sch√∂n schnell, aber es ist wirklich f√ºr jeden zu empfehlen. Man muss in dem Spiel mit einem Handschuh gr√∂√üere W√ºrfel und auch sich selber bewegen um weiter zu kommen. Dabei nutzt man Gravitation, die man durch den Handschuh und spezielle stellen an der Wand ausl√∂st. Begleitet wird man dabei von Gorg und Shi. Gorg ist ein sprechender und schwebender Computerw√ºrfel (so nenne ich ihn mal). Shi ist eine Sprachassistentin, die auf alles h√∂rt was Gorg sagt. Man selber kann aber nicht mit ihr oder Gorg reden, weil man in dem Spiel nicht reden kann. Das Spiel ist auf jeden Fall eine nette kleine Abwechslung und kostenlos. Damit kann ich nur jedem empfehlen es mal zu spielen.

Ich hoffe das euch meine Beurteilung geholfen hat einen Einblick in dieses Spiel zu bekommen.
 
Truck-Driver 2000 [GER]

Duration: 89 minutes in total

First time played.

I've seen this pop on this list a few times. Free on Steam. Great little puzzle first person perspective game reminiscent of portal in a way.

As previously said, it's quick, fun, and free! What's not to like. A great game to play at the end of a hard day for 60-90 minutes of escapism.

Download now and have a break from reality!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 mai 2022
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

–î–ª—è —Ñ–∞–Ω–∞—Ç—ñ–≤ Portal —Ç–µ —â–æ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–∞.
 
Yarloren
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
3.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 juin 2022
Overview:
'Gravitas' is a first person puzzle game where you play as an individual that enters "G.O.R.G" (or Gallery of Refined Gravity), a facility full of different puzzles revolving the manipulation of gravity. Throughout your puzzling, you're accompanied by a floating curator robot that monitors your progress and ability to solve the puzzles within the gallery. The entire game is very reminiscent of the vastly popular 'Portal' series with brain challenging puzzles that require solving all while there's an artificial intelligence with a personality that ends up getting more and more twisted as you play the game.

Although you might call 'Gravitas' a copycat of such, it is still a game done extremely and I mean extremely well and needs no explaining as to why the reviews are so positive. The game speaks for itself, it adopts an idea that has already been explored but isn't a detriment to it simply because it executes the concepts so well and feels like it's own game rather than another title that really wants to bank on the success of another. This is probably one of the very few games where I see no underlying issues and honestly could potentially say, is perfect in every department. The gameplay is intuitive with a healthy amount of challenge but not cryptic to the point of impossible and the humour isn't overdone and is a breath of fresh air from all the puzzling. It's an amazing game and honestly I would recommend it for gamers of all sorts.

Gameplay:
You play through 7 thoroughly thought out levels with various puzzles that can be a bit challenging but for the most part are pretty straightforward. I never once had to look up a walkthrough because the puzzles were easy enough to figure out but I did get lost for a few minutes for one of them. The concept of manipulating gravity to solve puzzles goes a pretty long way with the game introducing multiple different ways to manoeuvre around the map and progress to the next area keeping the feeling of the game fresh.

All while a rather humorous curator in the form of a computer AI attempts to converse with you but always comes off as awkward as it hasn't been in contact with any test subjects in a long time. The curator makes the game even more enjoyable and is a game changer when it comes to what makes a puzzle game fun. Seriously, without the curator, 'Gravitas' would just be another one of those puzzle games that exist with no rhyme or reason. But instead it presents a character with a very in-depth personality and adds a lot of life to what appears to be a simple puzzle game.

Not only that, but having a constantly changing computer AI opens up a lot of possibilities of what developers can do with the game to keep it fresh and unique. Let's be honest, having a game that throws puzzles at you in the same old dingy rooms again and again faces the risk of being repetitive at some point. But when you have an observer that gradually becomes more and more evil and corrupt, it allows the world you're in to become altered and warped by these villains in a way that not only changes up the gameplay, mood and setting, but also makes you elicit feelings towards the characters that normally isn't seen in these types of games. And for a free title, this is absolutely one that deserves the praise if not the money.

Controls:
Functional, fluent and works perfectly fine. For a game where you just have two functions, you'd imagine it'd be hard to mess the game up but you'd be surprised by how many game developers fail to program even simple puzzle piece games properly. 'Gravitas' obviously doesn't fall victim to such trivial mishaps and controls without any issues. Despite this, the game still has a control section with an image showing which keys are used and what they do. Although you can't rebind them, you really don't need to.

Graphics:
Pretty detailed and good looking all things considered. Despite the game attempting to try at a minimalistic approach, it still manages to push in a good amount of detail with surfaces actually having texture to them. The color scheme is pretty lackluster but the absence of color vibrancy actually compliments the idea that the building you're in is nothing more than a testing facility and the colors that are presented do just enough to make the game not overly plain looking. Shading and lighting are done nicely and add to the already great ambience and setting you're in.

Audio:
Absolutely amazing with more than decent sound effects, ambience, music and don't even get me started with the voice acting. The curator has such a fleshed out personality that you really feel as if there's a real person inside that tiny robot. The emotions that the curator portrays through it's voice ranges from happy to sad, mad, and just straight out evil. The curator's voice isn't as good as the infamous Glad0s or Wheatley from the 'Portal' series but still does a spectacular job at presenting an artificial intelligence becoming overly obsessed with having a test subject to observe and record. The whole premise surrounding the game and the curator progressively changing is experienced and felt through just playing the game even if you're not directly interacting with it. It's very impressive.

Conclusion/TL;DR:
'Gravitas' is a short but magnificent first person puzzle game themed around solving puzzles by manipulating gravity. It's very similar to the 'Portal' series as it consists of the player partaking in solving relatively easy and straightforward puzzles all while a supposedly friendly AI monitors and observes them. As the game advances, the AI unsurprisingly becomes overly attached to the player and transitions from awkwardly friendly to dangerously obsessive with the primary goal of keeping the player in the facility to continue testing for all eternity.

It's not quite like the popular predecessor but man does it do a damn good job at what it set out to do. 'Gravitas' is one of those hidden gems you do not want to miss especially if you're into this type of genre. If you enjoy first person puzzle games, comedic-turned-dark games or hell, just games in general, then 'Gravitas' is a serious must try. You'd be doing your game playing urge a disservice by not giving this sadly obscure masterpiece a chance.
 
The Old Taylor Swiftsz

√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 novembre 2021
Very simple and short. As iterated many times by others the puzzles are not that hard but are still creative.

I do believe that more could have been done with the mechanics, though, with maybe some added features/utility. Only weakness of the game is that it isn't that long and the story consequently isn't the most memorable.

Still, it is very good.

Also, wished I could have gravitied the Curator. There was one opportunity near the end where he aligned with a panel thing but alas, the game apparently did not allow it.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 avril 2021
First off, i gotta say this is a real good game.

My Rating: 87/100

Story: 9,5/10 The story is good, but short.

Gameplay: 10/10

Difficulty: At some levels you have to think a little bit, but it's not difficult.

Graphics: 8,5/10
(My graphic points are based on the graphic and what year the game was released. So for example if the game is from 2010 and the graphics are good for 2010, it's a 10/10.)

Sounddesign / Music: 8,5/10

Duration: One Story Run: 0,5h - 1h, 100% Steam Achievments: 1,5h - 2h

Replayability: Yes if you whait a bit

Price: Game: Free (Absolutely Worth it)

Additional comments:
You get a glove that allows you to create a beam that attracts things and you have to solve puzzles with it.
The puzzles are well made.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 11 aout 2020
La idea de el juego no es original y es demasiado inspirado a Portal. Los puzzles que ofrece este juego son muy simples y me ha aburrido. Encima el juego no ha hecho nada para alargarlo, porque me he pasado en una hora estando a veces afk. Lo siento, la verdad no me ha divertido para nada pero respecto que los haya gustado y si quieren algo mas increible comprad la saga de Portal cuando este en oferta por si no han jugado.
 
Dare_The_Runner
0
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 aout 2020
Phenomenal game! I cannot believe that its free.

It seems like a great blend between Q.U.B.E. (in its graphic design) and Portal (in the gameplay and commentary sense).

The visuals are outstanding. What you see in the screenshots are exactly what you get in game, even that gorgeous lighting!

The puzzles are simple but very fun. Your main tool is similar to the excursion funnels from Portal 2, but you can place them on certain surfaces to pull yourself and various types of cubes in.

The acting was hilarious, i found myself dying of laughter within the first few minutes of playing. There are also a number of portal references in both the game and voice lines for the more keen players.

The only ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• I can see is that the game is a little too reminiscent of Portal, and it is extremely short. Given that its free, however, I would recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of puzzle platformers!
 
Catalyst
376 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
4.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 aout 2020
The game design isn't what I was expecting when I read that it uses gravity for the sake of puzzle mechanics. You don't alter gravity everywhere, you just make pretty little tubes of get-over-there. The puzzles on their own aren't especially excellent, but the presentation of the narrator is excellent and the narrative felt very fresh to me. I genuinely feel like the mindset suggested by the narrator: to view the puzzles as works of art adds a delightful bit of depth to the game. There are about 8 puzzles in all, if I remember correctly so the game isn't very long. But, overall, I think this game is worth a play if you're in to the genre. If you don't want to buy Portal or want something similar and more concise, this game absolutely delivers.
 
Trash-chan

Recommand√©
3.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 avril 2020
I liked it. Why? Let's go through my points.

Plot
It's poor, but the game is short enough that it doesn't matter, because you're focused on puzzles

Sounds and music
They're unfortunatelly probably taken from some kind of free sounds repository, but they fit perfectly.

Gameplay
It's great. Gives me portal vibes. The idea is taken from Portal 2, but in Portal it wasn't used this way, so big plus.

Graphics
They're simple, but good. They fit the climate of this game.

Summing up, if you've enjoyed Portal, you will find this game fun.

BenjaminBE4
231 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
3.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 d√©cembre 2019
I genuinely loved this game, seriously. It may be only around 1-2 hours depending on how good you are at puzzle games, but they're probably the best two hours I've spent on a game like this. It's short, but full of charm with each characters' dialogue.

The only really annoying thing with it is that it seems even after beating each level several times, at least one of the level completion achievements keeps locking itself, meaning I sadly can't 100% the game. I do hope the developers could fix this or simply help me figure out what's going on as it's the first game this has happened in.

Other that that, I'd highly recommend that you play this game, even if you only have a semi-modern computer (you can lower some graphics settings). Plus, it's free!

I'm excited for whatever the team goes on to make next! :D

Recommand√©
2.0 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 novembre 2019
Jesus Christ, this game was a treat. The humor was amazing and I think I laughed more times in and hour and a half then I have in the past 2 months. I got this game randomly in my queue and gave it a try, I am glad that I did because it was a short and sweet adventure puzzle game. I havent found video games as fun as I did when I was younger, but this (besides CS:GO) is what keeps me wanting to try new games and keep playing games in general.

My only compliant is that the game is short, however I dont think the story should be altered, just some free DLC released or some mod tools made for this game by the devs.

Recommand√©
1.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 19 juin 2020
This game is exactly like Portal 2! But instead of a portal gun you have the ability of gravity at your disposal to get through some tricky and fun puzzles! It's really cool especially for A FREE GAME. Which honestly should be a game you should pay for if it was a little longer. The curator is very similar to Wheatley as well: Talkative, high-strung, and the most important thing trying to betray you or kill you.

Recommand√©
2.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 15 mars 2023
Pretty short and sweet puzzle platformer. There is really no reason not to play this game.

Pros:
- Original game mechanics
- Levels are strictly increasing in difficulty from very easy to medium-hard
- Sometimes funny, jokes about software development (can be a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• depending on you)

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
- The ending is inconclusive. We've been introduced to cool characters, but nothing really happens. So don't play for the plot and don't expect any Shyamalan-like twists.

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
2.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 avril 2021
Do you like portal?. Do you like the gravity mechanic from it? AND most importantly: Would you enjoy having an artistic recreation from weatley? (comedy, bit of storytelling). From my perspective this game deserves to be one of the few games which can be completed in under an hour while remaining completely entertaining, it even manages to be replayable thanks to its "branching" dialogue (dont expect tell-tale games grade of branching; nevertheless it's good), interesting characters and replayable segments of a puzzle thanks to its polished mechanics.

TL;DR: (PoRtAL 3 ThE MiNiGaME)^3

Recommand√©
3.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 mars 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

{Graficos) : 3D al mejor estilo portal y hasta un poco mas modernos
9/10

{Jugabilidad) : Puzzles copados y buen manejo de la fisica. Dificultad media
10/10

{La Platinacion) : Para algunos logros tuve que buscar una guia ( mas para buscar los tiburones ). Lo jugaras mas de una vez. No lo platine pero hay un logro que aun no se como lo hare, me resulta algo injusto (llevar el tacho mas bugueado que te puedas imaginar de un lado al otro).

{Duracion) : No muy largo. Capaz que en una o dos tardes te lo platinas ( a esepcion de ese maldito logro)

{Requisitos) : Pc medio

{Historia) : No es una copia de portal, es mas bien basado ya que presenta una historia totalmente diferente y el conservador del museo es un capo

{Rese√±a Final) : Si jugaste Portal y te quedaste ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ganas de mas, te lo recomiendo y si no jugaste portal y no los quieres comprar por taca√±o, te lo recomiendo.


9/10

√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 septembre 2019
First impressions were not good. No proper ultrawide resolution support and the FOV was too narrow for the aspect ratio.

I made a post on the forums and a developer reached out to ask further questions. Within days a patch was out and I could enjoy the game.

10/10 best devs, thank you for caring about your players!

Recommand√©

√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 aout 2019
5 easy puzzles and a difficult final one, where I was probably just overthinking. Beatable in less than 30 minutes. If you like hunting achievements, there's some extra time in it for you. The dialogues aren't funny and only annoyed me, I'd have preferred more puzzles over bad jokes. I'd give the game a "meh" rating, but it's free, so if you like Portal-like games, just give it a shot.
 
Charming Cthulhu
